result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby J. Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $131.75 plus surcharges; jointly & severally with 15CF382 and 15CF384.
Spend 9 months in the county jail w/huber privileges (credit for 191 days served).  May not have contact with Brendan Styles, Joseph Ferguson, Richard Madeja, Jr., or their residences, or Toppers Pizza in Kenosha, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges allowed.  Credit for 191 days served.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions, 9 months conditional jail w/Huber privileges; credit for 191 days served; pay $250 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $131.75, joint & several with 15CF382 & 15CF384.
from S. Washington
With Atty Rose the time of the SEH on 10/29/15 is changed from 2:30pm to 2pm, due to a conflict w/the court's calendar.
FROM DE TO COURT

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 10/29/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rose states he would like to know if deft's statement will be used.  ADA Delgado states she needs time to review the file.  STC set for 6/22/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. Joseph Ferguson appeared (in custody) with Atty. Jerold Breitenbach. Def. Bobby Price appeared (in custody) with Atty. Terry Rose. Def. Brendan Styles appeared (in custody) with Atty. Don Bielski. Clerk LE. Preliminary hearings held jointly for co-defs in 15CF382, 383, and 384. KPD Det. Leonard Giannola sworn in and testified on behalf of State. Cross-examination by Atty. Breitenbach. Cross-examination by Atty. Rose. Cross-examination by Atty. Bielski. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-4-15 @ 8:15am with co-defs. Bond continued.
